src:
General Election 2019 LIVE: Latest news as first election TV debate confirmed for November 19
01 Nov 2019, 17:21 by https://www.facebook.com/SunPolitics/

THE first TV head-to-head between Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn has been set for November 19.

Ahead of the December general election, the Prime Minister and the Labour leader will face off later this month.






















Ellie Cambridge3 minutes agoNovember 1, 2019HEAD-TO-HEAD The first TV debate between Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn has been set for November 19. They will face off in a likely fierce debate covered by ITV, as they bid to come out victorious in December's general election.
Alex Matthews3 hours agoNovember 1, 2019COLD WAR CORBYN Jeremy Corbyn would sensationally snub Donald Trump if he becomes PM by refusing to visit the White House in his first year in office. Barry Gardiner dismissed the US President as being on the side of the “super rich” and said the Labour boss would focus on Europe if he reached No10. He ranted to the BBC: “The importance would, I think, be with Europe in the first place. 'We need to establish the future relationship that we have with Europe and therefore I would imagine that certainly in the first 12 months, our focus would be on the European Union. 'We are not talking about Jeremy Corbyn wanting to go over to America.” Labour's trade chief Mr Gardiner furiously hit back at Mr Trump after the President said Corbyn in No10 would be "so bad" for the UK.
Alex Matthews3 hours agoNovember 1, 2019'SCREWED UP' Tory Brexiteer Mark Francois believes Nigel Farage has “screwed up” with his election warning to Boris Johnson. Mr Francois, deputy chair of Conservative Eurosceptic group – the ERG, said: “I think Nigel screwed it up. “If you genuinely want to work with another political party, you don’t go on live national television and call them liars, which is what he did. “If that was meant to be to be an olive branch, Nigel completely cocked it up.”
Alex Matthews5 hours agoNovember 1, 2019VOTE FARAGE AND YOU'LL GET CORBYN Tory chairman James Cleverly said Nigel Farage could derail Brexit and warned voters that backing him would see Mr Corbyn in Downing Street. He said: “A vote for Farage risks letting Jeremy Corbyn into Downing Street via the back door – and the country spending 2020 having two referendums on Brexit and Scottish independence. “It will not get Brexit done – and it will create another gridlocked Parliament that doesn’t work.”
Alex Matthews5 hours agoNovember 1, 2019WILL HE STAND?  Mr Farage refused to rule out whether he would be standing as an MP in the election and said his own plans would be a “massive distraction” from his quest to broker a Leave Alliance. He told reporters: “We're going to announce all of that in the next few days.”

Load more entries…
